constructor.name: Array
constructor.description: Constructs a new array with specified size.
constructor.summary: Constructs a new array with specified size.

constructor.name: Array
constructor.description: Constructs a new array that contains the given values.
constructor.summary: Constructs a new array that contains the given values.

constructor.name: Array
constructor.description: Constructs a new array that contains the given values.
constructor.summary: Constructs a new array that contains the given values.

property.name: [index]
property.description: Get an element by index.
property.summary: Get an element by index.

property.name: length
property.description: Get the length of the array.
property.summary: Get the length of the array.

function.name: concat
function.description: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).
function.summary: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).

function.name: concat
function.description: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).
function.summary: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).

function.name: concat
function.description: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).
function.summary: Returns a new array comprised of this array joined with other array(s) and/or value(s).

function.name: every
function.description: Runs a function on items in the array while that function is returning true. It returns true if the function returns true for every item it could visit. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.
function.summary: Runs a function on items in the array while that function is returning true.

function.name: every
function.description: Runs a function on items in the array while that function is returning true. It returns true if the function returns true for every item it could visit. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.
function.summary: Runs a function on items in the array while that function is returning true.

function.name: filter
function.description: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns an array of all items for which the function returns true. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.
function.summary: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns an array of all items for which the function returns true.

function.name: filter
function.description: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns an array of all items for which the function returns true. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.
function.summary: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns an array of all items for which the function returns true.

function.name: forEach
function.description: Runs a function (callback) on every item in the array. The callback function is invoked only for indexes of the array which have assigned values. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.
function.summary: Runs a function (callback) on every item in the array.

function.name: forEach
function.description: Runs a function (callback) on every item in the array. The callback function is invoked only for indexes of the array which have assigned values. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.
function.summary: Runs a function (callback) on every item in the array.

function.name: indexOf
function.description: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.
function.summary: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

function.name: indexOf
function.description: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.
function.summary: Returns the first index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

function.name: isArray
function.description: Checks whether an object is an array or not.
function.summary: Checks whether an object is an array or not.

function.name: join
function.description: Puts all elements in the array into a string, separating each element with the specified delimiter
function.summary: Puts all elements in the array into a string, separating each element with the specified delimiter

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var jwords = words.join(";");

function.name: lastIndexOf
function.description: Returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present. The array is searched backwards, starting at fromIndex.
function.summary: Returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

function.name: lastIndexOf
function.description: Returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present. The array is searched backwards, starting at fromIndex.
function.summary: Returns the last index at which a given element can be found in the array, or -1 if it is not present.

function.name: map
function.description: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns the results in an array. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.
function.summary: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns the results in an array.

function.name: map
function.description: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns the results in an array. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.
function.summary: Runs a function on every item in the array and returns the results in an array.

function.name: pop
function.description: Pops the last string off the array and returns it.
function.summary: Pops the last string off the array and returns it.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var lastword = words.pop();

function.name: push
function.description: Mutates an array by appending the given elements and returning the new length of the array.
function.summary: Mutates an array by appending the given elements and returning the new length of the array.

function.name: push
function.description: Mutates an array by appending the given elements and returning the new length of the array.
function.summary: Mutates an array by appending the given elements and returning the new length of the array.

function.name: push
function.description: Mutates an array by appending the given elements and returning the new length of the array.
function.summary: Mutates an array by appending the given elements and returning the new length of the array.

function.name: reverse
function.description: Puts array elements in reverse order.
function.summary: Puts array elements in reverse order.

function.name: shift
function.description: Decreases array element size by one by shifting the first element off the array and returning it.
function.summary: Decreases array element size by one by shifting the first element off the array and returning it.

function.name: slice
function.description: The slice method creates a new array from a selected section of an array.
function.summary: The slice method creates a new array from a selected section of an array.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var nwords1 = words.slice(3, 5);

function.name: slice
function.description: The slice method creates a new array from a selected section of an array.
function.summary: The slice method creates a new array from a selected section of an array.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var nwords1 = words.slice(3, 5);

function.name: some
function.description: Runs a function on items in the array while that function returns false. It returns true if the function returns true for any item it could visit. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.
function.summary: Runs a function on items in the array while that function returns false.

function.name: some
function.description: Runs a function on items in the array while that function returns false. It returns true if the function returns true for any item it could visit. The callback function is invoked with three arguments: the element value, the element index, the array being traversed.
function.summary: Runs a function on items in the array while that function returns false.

function.name: sort
function.description: Sorts the array elements in dictionary order or using a compare function passed to the method.
function.summary: Sorts the array elements in dictionary order or using a compare function passed to the method.

function.name: sort
function.description: Sorts the array elements in dictionary order or using a compare function passed to the method.
function.summary: Sorts the array elements in dictionary order or using a compare function passed to the method.

function.name: splice
function.description: It is used to take elements out of an array and replace them with those specified.
function.summary: It is used to take elements out of an array and replace them with those specified.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var nwords1 = words.splice(3, 2, "done", "On");

function.name: splice
function.description: It is used to take elements out of an array and replace them with those specified.
function.summary: It is used to take elements out of an array and replace them with those specified.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var nwords1 = words.splice(3, 2, "done", "On");

function.name: splice
function.description: It is used to take elements out of an array and replace them with those specified.
function.summary: It is used to take elements out of an array and replace them with those specified.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var nwords1 = words.splice(3, 2, "done", "On");

function.name: splice
function.description: It is used to take elements out of an array and replace them with those specified.
function.summary: It is used to take elements out of an array and replace them with those specified.

samples.sample: var words = new Array("limit","lines","finish","complete","In","Out"); var nwords1 = words.splice(3, 2, "done", "On");

function.name: unshift
function.description: Places element data at the start of an array.
function.summary: Places element data at the start of an array.

constructor.name: Date
constructor.description: Use the current date and time to create an instance of the object date.
constructor.summary: Use the current date and time to create an instance of the object date.

constructor.name: Date
constructor.description: Create instance of date. The argument is the number of milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC.

constructor.name: Date
constructor.description: Create an instance of date with the specified values.
constructor.summary: Create an instance of date with the specified values.

samples.sample: var date = new Date(year, month, day);

constructor.name: Date
constructor.description: Create an instance of date with the specified values.
constructor.summary: Create an instance of date with the specified values.

samples.sample: var date = new Date(year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds);

constructor.name: Date
constructor.description: Create an instance of date with the specified values.
constructor.summary: Create an instance of date with the specified values.

samples.sample: var date = new Date(year, month, day, hours, minutes, seconds, milliseconds)

constructor.name: Date
constructor.description: Use the date specified by the string to create the instance of the date object. String format is "month day, year hours:minutes:seconds".
constructor.summary: Use the date specified by the string to create the instance of the date object.

function.name: UTC
function.description: Takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the specified time.
function.summary: Takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the specified time.

samples.sample: // The number of milliseconds in the first minute after 1970 January 1st. application.output(Date.UTC(1970, 00, 01, 00, 01, 00, 00)); // prints: 60000.0

function.name: UTC
function.description: Takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the specified time.
function.summary: Takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the specified time.

samples.sample: // The number of milliseconds in the first minute after 1970 January 1st. application.output(Date.UTC(1970, 00, 01, 00, 01, 00, 00)); // prints: 60000.0

function.name: UTC
function.description: Takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the specified time.
function.summary: Takes comma-delimited date parameters and returns the number of milliseconds between January 1, 1970, 00:00:00, universal time and the specified time.

samples.sample: // The number of milliseconds in the first minute after 1970 January 1st. application.output(Date.UTC(1970, 00, 01, 00, 01, 00, 00)); // prints: 60000.0

function.name: getDate
function.description: Gets the day of month.
function.summary: Gets the day of month.

function.name: getDay
function.description: Gets the day of the week (sunday = 0).
function.summary: Gets the day of the week (sunday = 0).

function.name: getFullYear
function.description: Gets the full year of the date.
function.summary: Gets the full year of the date.

function.name: getHours
function.description: Gets the hours of the date.
function.summary: Gets the hours of the date.

function.name: getMilliseconds
function.description: Gets the milliseconds of the date.
function.summary: Gets the milliseconds of the date.

function.name: getMinutes
function.description: Gets the minutes of the date.
function.summary: Gets the minutes of the date.

function.name: getMonth
function.description: Gets the month of the date.
function.summary: Gets the month of the date.

function.name: getSeconds
function.description: Gets the seconds of the date.
function.summary: Gets the seconds of the date.

function.name: getTime
function.description: The value returned by the getTime method is the number of milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00.
function.summary: The value returned by the getTime method is the number of milliseconds since 1 January 1970 00:00:00.

function.name: getTimezoneOffset
function.description: Gets the number of minutes between GMT and this date.
function.summary: Gets the number of minutes between GMT and this date.

function.summary: Gets the seconds in UTC time.

function.name: now
function.description: Returns the milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC up until now.
function.summary: Returns the milliseconds elapsed since 1 January 1970 00:00:00 UTC up until now.

function.name: parse
function.description: Takes a date string (such as "Dec 25, 1995") and returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.
function.summary: Takes a date string (such as "Dec 25, 1995") and returns the number of milliseconds since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

samples.sample: var str = Date.parse("Wed, 09 Aug 1995 00:00:00 GMT"); application.output(str);

function.name: toDateString
function.description: Returns a string version of the date.
function.summary: Returns a string version of the date.

function.name: toLocaleDateString
function.description: Returns a string version of the local time zone of the date.

function.description: Returns a string version of the local time zone of the date.

function.description: Returns a string version of the date.
function.summary: Returns a string version of the date.

function.summary: Returns a string version of the UTC value of the date.

function.name: valueOf
function.description: Return integer milliseconds count
function.summary: Return integer milliseconds count

property.name: constructor
property.description: Specifies the function that creates an object's prototype.
property.summary: Specifies the function that creates an object's prototype.

property.name: length
property.description: Specifies the number of arguments expected by the function.
property.summary: Specifies the number of arguments expected by the function.

function.name: apply
function.description: Applies the method of another object in the context of a different object (the calling object); arguments can be passed as an Array object.
function.summary: Applies the method of another object in the context of a different object (the calling object); arguments can be passed as an Array object.

function.name: bind
function.description: Creates a new function which, when called, itself calls this function in the context of the provided value, with a given sequence of arguments preceding any provided when the new function was called.
function.summary: Creates a new function which, when called, itself calls this function in the context of the provided value, with a given sequence of arguments preceding any provided when the new function was called.

function.name: call
function.description: Calls (executes) a method of another object in the context of a different object (the calling object); arguments can be passed as they are.
function.summary: Calls (executes) a method of another object in the context of a different object (the calling object); arguments can be passed as they are.

function.name: toString
function.description: Returns a string representing the source code of the function. Overrides the Object.toString method.
function.summary: Returns a string representing the source code of the function.

property.name: Infinity
property.description: Numeric value representing infinity.
property.summary: Numeric value representing infinity.

property.name: NaN
property.description: Value representing Not-a-Number.
property.summary: Value representing Not-a-Number.

property.name: undefined
property.description: The value undefined.
property.summary: The value undefined.

function.name: decodeURI
function.description: Decodes a URI previously encoded with encodeURI or another similar routine.
function.summary: Decodes a URI previously encoded with encodeURI or another similar routine.

function.name: decodeURIComponent
function.description: Decodes a URI component previously created by encodeURIComponent or by a similar routine.
function.summary: Decodes a URI component previously created by encodeURIComponent or by a similar routine.

function.name: encodeURI
function.description: Encodes a URI by replacing certain characters with escape sequences.
function.summary: Encodes a URI by replacing certain characters with escape sequences.

function.name: encodeURIComponent
function.description: Encodes a URI component by replacing all special characters with their corresponding UTF-8 escape sequences.
function.summary: Encodes a URI component by replacing all special characters with their corresponding UTF-8 escape sequences.

function.name: escape
function.description: Returns the hexadecimal encoding of a given string.
function.summary: Returns the hexadecimal encoding of a given string.
function.deprecated: Not needed anymore, use native javascript methods (escape(string)).

function.name: eval
function.description: Evaluates JavaScript code passed as a string. Returns the value returned by the evaluated code.
function.summary: Evaluates JavaScript code passed as a string.

function.name: isFinite
function.description: Returns true if the given number is a finite number.
function.summary: Returns true if the given number is a finite number.

samples.sample: application.output(isFinite(1)); // prints: true application.output(isFinite(Infinity)); // prints: false application.output(isFinite(isNaN)); // prints: false

function.name: isNaN
function.description: The NaN property indicates that a value is 'Not a Number'.
function.summary: The NaN property indicates that a value is 'Not a Number'.

function.name: isXMLName
function.description: Returns true if the given name can be used as a valid name for an XML element or attribute.
function.summary: Returns true if the given name can be used as a valid name for an XML element or attribute.

samples.sample: application.output(isXMLName("good_name")); // prints: true application.output(isXMLName("bad name")); // because of the space, prints: false

function.name: parseFloat
function.description: Makes a floating point number from the starting numbers in a given string.
function.summary: Makes a floating point number from the starting numbers in a given string.

function.name: parseInt
function.description: Makes a integer from the starting numbers in a given string in the base specified.
function.summary: Makes a integer from the starting numbers in a given string in the base specified.

function.name: parseInt
function.description: Makes a integer from the starting numbers in a given string in the base specified.
function.summary: Makes a integer from the starting numbers in a given string in the base specified.

function.name: unescape
function.description: Returns the ASCII encoding of a string that was previously encoded with escape or another similar routine.
function.summary: Returns the ASCII encoding of a string that was previously encoded with escape or another similar routine.
function.deprecated: Not needed anymore, use native javascript methods (unescape(string)).

function.name: uneval
function.description: Returns the string representation behind a given object.
function.summary: Returns the string representation behind a given object.

samples.sample: application.output(uneval(isNaN)); // prints something like: function isNaN() { [native code for isNaN, arity=1] }

function.name: parse
function.description: Parses a string as JSON and returns the parsed value.
function.summary: Parses a string as JSON and returns the parsed value.

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The string to parse as JSON. See the JSON object for a description of JSON syntax.

function.name: parse
function.description: Parses a string as JSON and returns the parsed value.
function.summary: Parses a string as JSON and returns the parsed value.

samples.sample: var transformed = JSON.parse('{"p": 5}', function(k, v) { if (k === "") return v; return v * 2; });

parameter.name: text
parameter.description: The string to parse as JSON. See the JSON object for a description of JSON syntax.

parameter.name: reviver
parameter.description: A function, prescribes how the value originally produced by parsing is transformed, before being returned.

function.name: stringify
function.description: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified
function.summary: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to convert to a JSON string.

function.name: stringify
function.description: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified
function.summary: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to convert to a JSON string.

parameter.name: replacer
parameter.description: If a function, transforms values and properties encountered while stringifying; if an array, specifies the set of properties included in objects in the final string.

function.name: stringify
function.description: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified
function.summary: Convert a value to JSON, optionally replacing values if a replacer function is specified, or optionally including only the specified properties if a replacer array is specified

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value to convert to a JSON string.

parameter.name: replacer
parameter.description: If a function, transforms values and properties encountered while stringifying; if an array, specifies the set of properties included in objects in the final string.

parameter.name: space
parameter.description: The space argument may be used to control spacing in the final string. If it is a number, successive levels in the stringification will each be indented by this many space characters (up to 10). If it is a string, successive levels will indented by this string (or the first ten characters of it).

property.name: E
property.description: Euler's constant and the base of natural logarithms. Approximately 2.718.
property.summary: Euler's constant and the base of natural logarithms.

property.name: LN10
property.description: Natural logarithm of 10. Approximately 2.302.
property.summary: Natural logarithm of 10.

property.name: LN2
property.description: Natural logarithm of 2. Approximately 0.693.
property.summary: Natural logarithm of 2.

property.name: LOG10E
property.description: Base 10 logarithm of E. Approximately 0.434.
property.summary: Base 10 logarithm of E.

property.name: LOG2E
property.description: Base 2 logarithm of E. Approximately 1.442.
property.summary: Base 2 logarithm of E.

property.name: PI
property.description: Ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter. Approximately 3.14159.
property.summary: Ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter.

property.name: SQRT1_2
property.description: Square root of 1/2. Equivalently, 1 over the square root of 2, approximately 0.707.
property.summary: Square root of 1/2.

property.name: SQRT2
property.description: Square root of 2. Approximately 1.414.
property.summary: Square root of 2.

function.name: abs
function.description: Returns the absolute value of a number.
function.summary: Returns the absolute value of a number.

function.name: acos
function.description: Returns the arccosine (in radians) of a number.
function.summary: Returns the arccosine (in radians) of a number.

function.name: asin
function.description: Returns the arcsine (in radians) of a number.
function.summary: Returns the arcsine (in radians) of a number.

function.name: atan
function.description: Returns the arctangent (in radians) of a number.
function.summary: Returns the arctangent (in radians) of a number.

function.name: atan2
function.description: Returns the arctangent of the quotient of its arguments.
function.summary: Returns the arctangent of the quotient of its arguments.

function.name: ceil
function.description: Returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to a number.
function.summary: Returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to a number.

function.name: cos
function.description: Returns the cosine of a number.
function.summary: Returns the cosine of a number.

function.name: exp
function.description: Returns Enumber, where number is the argument, and E is Euler's constant, the base of the natural logarithms.
function.summary: Returns Enumber, where number is the argument, and E is Euler's constant, the base of the natural logarithms.

function.name: floor
function.description: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to a number.
function.summary: Returns the largest integer less than or equal to a number.

function.name: log
function.description: Returns the natural logarithm (base E) of a number.
function.summary: Returns the natural logarithm (base E) of a number.

function.name: max
function.description: Returns the greater of two (or more) numbers.
function.summary: Returns the greater of two (or more) numbers.

function.name: min
function.description: Returns the lesser of two (or more) numbers.
function.summary: Returns the lesser of two (or more) numbers.

function.name: pow
function.description: Returns base to the exponent power, that is, base exponent.
function.summary: Returns base to the exponent power, that is, base exponent.

function.name: random
function.description: Returns a pseudo-random number between 0 and 1.
function.summary: Returns a pseudo-random number between 0 and 1.

function.name: round
function.description: Returns the value of a number rounded to the nearest integer.
function.summary: Returns the value of a number rounded to the nearest integer.

function.name: sin
function.description: Returns the sine of a number.
function.summary: Returns the sine of a number.

function.name: sqrt
function.description: Returns the square root of a number.
function.summary: Returns the square root of a number.

function.name: tan
function.description: Returns the tangent of a number.
function.summary: Returns the tangent of a number.

property.name: prefix
property.description: Identifies the prefix of this namespace, if applicable.
property.summary: Identifies the prefix of this namespace, if applicable.

property.name: uri
property.description: Identifies the namespace of this Namespace, if applicable.
property.summary: Identifies the namespace of this Namespace, if applicable.

property.name: MAX_VALUE
property.description: The largest representable number.
property.summary: The largest representable number.

property.name: MIN_VALUE
property.description: The smallest representable number.
property.summary: The smallest representable number.

property.name: NEGATIVE_INFINITY
property.description: Special value representing negative infinity; returned on overflow.
property.summary: Special value representing negative infinity; returned on overflow.

property.name: NaN
property.description: Special "not a number" value.
property.summary: Special "not a number" value.

property.name: POSITIVE_INFINITY
property.description: Special value representing infinity; returned on overflow.
property.summary: Special value representing infinity; returned on overflow.

function.name: toExponential
function.return: A string representing the number in exponential notation.
function.description: Returns a string representing the number in exponential notation.
function.summary: Returns a string representing the number in exponential notation.

function.name: toExponential
function.return: A string representing the number in exponential notation.
function.description: Returns a string representing the number in exponential notation.
function.summary: Returns a string representing the number in exponential notation.

parameter.name: fractionDigits
parameter.description: An integer specifying the number of digits after the decimal point. Defaults to as many digits as necessary to specify the number.

function.name: toFixed
function.return: A string representing the number in fixed-point notation.
function.description: Returns a string representing the number in fixed-point notation.
function.summary: Returns a string representing the number in fixed-point notation.

function.name: toFixed
function.return: A string representing the number in fixed-point notation.
function.description: Returns a string representing the number in fixed-point notation.
function.summary: Returns a string representing the number in fixed-point notation.

parameter.name: digits
parameter.description: The number of digits to appear after the decimal point. Defaults to 0.

function.name: toLocaleString
function.return: A string representing the number in the current locale.
function.description: Converts the number into a string which is suitable for presentation in the given locale.
function.summary: Converts the number into a string which is suitable for presentation in the given locale.

function.name: toPrecision
function.return: A string representing the number to a specified precision in fixed-point or exponential notation.
function.description: Returns a string representing the number to a specified precision in fixed-point or exponential notation.
function.summary: Returns a string representing the number to a specified precision in fixed-point or exponential notation.

function.name: toPrecision
function.return: A string representing the number to a specified precision in fixed-point or exponential notation.
function.description: Returns a string representing the number to a specified precision in fixed-point or exponential notation.
function.summary: Returns a string representing the number to a specified precision in fixed-point or exponential notation.

parameter.name: precision
parameter.description: An integer specifying the number of significant digits.

function.name: toString
function.return: A string representing the specified Number object.
function.description: Returns a string representing the specified Number object.
function.summary: Returns a string representing the specified Number object.

function.name: toString
function.return: A string representing the specified Number object.
function.description: Returns a string representing the specified Number object.
function.summary: Returns a string representing the specified Number object.

parameter.name: radix
parameter.description: An integer between 2 and 36 specifying the base to use for representing numeric values

property.name: localName
property.description: Identifies the local name of the QName.
property.summary: Identifies the local name of the QName.

property.name: uri
property.description: Identifies the namespace of the QName, if applicable.
property.summary: Identifies the namespace of the QName, if applicable.

property.name: global
property.description: Specifies if the "g" modifier is set.
property.summary: Specifies if the "g" modifier is set.

property.name: ignoreCase
property.description: Specifies if the "i" modifier is set.
property.summary: Specifies if the "i" modifier is set.

property.name: input
property.description: The string on which the pattern match is performed.
property.summary: The string on which the pattern match is performed.

property.name: lastIndex
property.description: An integer specifying the index at which to start the next match.
property.summary: An integer specifying the index at which to start the next match.

property.name: lastMatch
property.description: The last matched characters.
property.summary: The last matched characters.

property.name: lastParen
property.description: The last matched parenthesized substring.
property.summary: The last matched parenthesized substring.

property.name: leftContext
property.description: The substring in front of the characters most recently matched.
property.summary: The substring in front of the characters most recently matched.

property.name: multiline
property.description: Specifies if the "m" modifier is set.
property.summary: Specifies if the "m" modifier is set.

property.name: rightContext
property.description: The substring after the characters most recently matched
property.summary: The substring after the characters most recently matched

property.name: source
property.description: The text used for pattern matching.
property.summary: The text used for pattern matching.

function.name: compile
function.description: Change the regular expression.
function.summary: Change the regular expression.
function.deprecated: use only the RegExp constructor (see also https://developer.mozilla.org/en/JavaScript/Reference/Deprecated_and_obsolete_features)

function.name: exec
function.return: A String representing the found value.
function.description: Search a string for a specified value. Returns the found value and remembers the position.
function.summary: Search a string for a specified value.

function.name: test
function.return: true if a match was found in the string. false otherwise.
function.description: Search a string for a specified value. Returns true or false.
function.summary: Search a string for a specified value.

function.name: typeof
function.description: Returns the type of the given object, one of these strings get returned: "number", "string", "boolean", "object", "function" or undefined if the object doesn't exists.
function.summary: Returns the type of the given object, one of these strings get returned: "number", "string", "boolean", "object", "function" or undefined if the object doesn't exists.

samples.sample: application.output(typeof "abc"); // string application.output(typeof 10); // number application.output(typeof 10.1); // number application.output(typeof true); // boolean application.output(typeof parseInt); // function application.output(typeof application); // object application.output(typeof somethingInexisting); // undefined

function.name: break
function.description: Break statement exits a loop.
function.summary: Break statement exits a loop.

function.name: const
function.description: Constant declaration.
function.summary: Constant declaration.

function.name: continue
function.description: Continue statement, jumps to next iteration of the loop.
function.summary: Continue statement, jumps to next iteration of the loop.

function.name: do while
function.description: do while loop
function.summary: do while loop

function.name: for each in
function.description: foreach loop

function.name: for
function.description: for loop
function.summary: for loop

function.name: if else
function.description: If/Else statement.
function.summary: If/Else statement.

function.name: if
function.description: If statement
function.summary: If statement

function.name: label
function.description:
Provides a statement with an identifier that you can refer to using a break or continue statement.
For example, you can use a label to identify a loop, and then use the break or continue statements to indicate whether a program should interrupt the loop or continue its execution.
function.summary: Provides a statement with an identifier that you can refer to using a break or continue statement.

function.name: switch
function.description: Switch statement.
function.summary: Switch statement.

function.name: try catch finally
function.description: try/catch/finally statement
function.summary: try/catch/finally statement

function.name: try catch
function.description: try/catch statement
function.summary: try/catch statement

function.name: var
function.description: Variable declaration
function.summary: Variable declaration

function.name: while
function.description: while loop
function.summary: while loop

property.name: length
property.description: Gives the length of the string.
property.summary: Gives the length of the string.

function.name: anchor
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an anchor <A> tag set.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an anchor <A> tag set.

function.name: big
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <BIG> tag set.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <BIG> tag set.

function.name: blink
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <BLINK> tag set.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <BLINK> tag set.

function.name: bold
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <B> tag set.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <B> tag set.

function.name: charAt
function.description: returns a character of the string.
function.summary: returns a character of the string.

function.name: charCodeAt
function.description: returns a decimal code of the char in the string.
function.summary: returns a decimal code of the char in the string.

function.name: concat
function.description: returns a string that appends the parameter string to the string.
function.summary: returns a string that appends the parameter string to the string.

function.name: concat
function.description: returns a string that appends the parameter string to the string.
function.summary: returns a string that appends the parameter string to the string.

function.name: equals
function.description: returns a boolean that checks if the given string is equal to the string
function.summary: returns a boolean that checks if the given string is equal to the string

function.name: equalsIgnoreCase
function.description: returns a boolean that checks if the given string is equal to the string ignoring case
function.summary: returns a boolean that checks if the given string is equal to the string ignoring case

function.name: fixed
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an anchor <TT> tag set.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an anchor <TT> tag set.

function.name: fontcolor
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <FONT> tag set, the color param is assigned the the color attribute.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <FONT> tag set, the color param is assigned the the color attribute.

function.name: fontsize
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <FONT> tag set, The size param is set to the SIZE attribute
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <FONT> tag set, The size param is set to the SIZE attribute

function.name: indexOf
function.description: returns the found index of the given string in string.
function.summary: returns the found index of the given string in string.

function.name: italics
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <I> tag set
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <I> tag set

function.name: lastIndexOf
function.description: returns the found index of the given string in string from the end.
function.summary: returns the found index of the given string in string from the end.

function.name: link
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <A> tag set.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <A> tag set.

function.name: match
function.description: returns an array of strings within the current string that matches the regexp.
function.summary: returns an array of strings within the current string that matches the regexp.

function.name: replace
function.description: returns a strings where all matches of the regexp are replaced.
function.summary: returns a strings where all matches of the regexp are replaced.

function.name: search
function.description: returns a index where the first match is found of the regexp
function.summary: returns a index where the first match is found of the regexp

function.name: slice
function.description: returns a substring of the string.
function.summary: returns a substring of the string.

function.name: slice
function.description: returns a substring of the string.
function.summary: returns a substring of the string.

function.name: small
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <SMALL> tag set.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <SMALL> tag set.

function.name: split
function.description: returns an array of objects whose elements are segments of the current string.
function.summary: returns an array of objects whose elements are segments of the current string.

function.name: strike
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <STRIKE> tag set.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <STRIKE> tag set.

function.name: sub
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <SUB> tag set.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <SUB> tag set.

function.name: substr
function.description: returns a substring of the string from the start with the number of chars specified.
function.summary: returns a substring of the string from the start with the number of chars specified.

function.name: substr
function.description: returns a substring of the string from the start with the number of chars specified.
function.summary: returns a substring of the string from the start with the number of chars specified.

function.name: substring
function.description: Returns a substring of the string from the start index until the end index.
function.summary: Returns a substring of the string from the start index until the end index.

function.name: substring
function.description: Returns a substring of the string from the start index until the end index.
function.summary: Returns a substring of the string from the start index until the end index.

function.name: sup
function.description: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <SUP> tag set.
function.summary: returns a copy of the string embedded within an <SUP> tag set.

function.name: toLowerCase
function.description: returns a string with all lowercase letters of the current string.
function.summary: returns a string with all lowercase letters of the current string.

function.name: toUpperCase
function.description: returns a string with all uppercase letters of the current string.
function.summary: returns a string with all uppercase letters of the current string.

property.name: ignoreComments
property.description: If set to true, then comments in the XML are ignored when constructing new XML objects.
property.summary: If set to true, then comments in the XML are ignored when constructing new XML objects.

property.name: ignoreProcessingInstructions
property.description: If set to true, then processing instructions are ignored when constructing new XML objects.
property.summary: If set to true, then processing instructions are ignored when constructing new XML objects.

property.name: ignoreWhitespace
property.description: If set to true, then whitespace in the XML is ignored when constructing new XML objects.
property.summary: If set to true, then whitespace in the XML is ignored when constructing new XML objects.

property.name: prettyIndent
property.description: The amount of positions used when indenting child nodes are relative to their parent if prettyPrinting is enabled.
property.summary: The amount of positions used when indenting child nodes are relative to their parent if prettyPrinting is enabled.

property.name: prettyPrinting
property.description: If set to true, then toString() and toXMLString() methods will normalize the output to achieve a uniform appearance.
property.summary: If set to true, then toString() and toXMLString() methods will normalize the output to achieve a uniform appearance.

function.name: addNamespace
function.description: Takes one argument which can be a string with a namespace URI or a Namespace object and adds the argument to the in scope namespaces of this XML object.
function.summary: Takes one argument which can be a string with a namespace URI or a Namespace object and adds the argument to the in scope namespaces of this XML object.

function.name: appendChild
function.description: Appends a new child at the end of this XML object's properties, the changed XML object is then returned.
function.summary: Appends a new child at the end of this XML object's properties, the changed XML object is then returned.

function.name: attribute
function.description: Takes a single argument with the attribute name and returns an XMLList with attributes matching the argument.
function.summary: Takes a single argument with the attribute name and returns an XMLList with attributes matching the argument.

function.name: attributes
function.description: Returns an XMLList with the attributes of this XML object which are in no namespace.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with the attributes of this XML object which are in no namespace.

function.name: child
function.description: Returns an XMLList with children matching the property name.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with children matching the property name.

function.name: childIndex
function.description: If the XML object has no parent then the special number NaN is returned, otherwise the ordinal position the object has in the context of its parent is returned.
function.summary: If the XML object has no parent then the special number NaN is returned, otherwise the ordinal position the object has in the context of its parent is returned.

function.name: children
function.description: Returns an XMLList with the child nodes of this XML object.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with the child nodes of this XML object.

function.name: comments
function.description: Returns an XMLList with the comment nodes which are children of this XML object.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with the comment nodes which are children of this XML object.

function.name: contains
function.description: Calling xmlObject.contains(value) yields the same result as the equality comparison xmlObject == value
function.summary: Calling xmlObject.

function.name: copy
function.description: Returns a deep copy of the XML object it is called on where the internal parent property is set to null
function.summary: Returns a deep copy of the XML object it is called on where the internal parent property is set to null

function.name: defaultSettings
function.description: Returns an object containing the default XML settings.
function.summary: Returns an object containing the default XML settings.

function.name: descendants
function.description: Returns an XMLList with the descendants matching the passed name argument or with all descendants if no argument is passed.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with the descendants matching the passed name argument or with all descendants if no argument is passed.

function.name: descendants
function.description: Returns an XMLList with the descendants matching the passed name argument or with all descendants if no argument is passed.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with the descendants matching the passed name argument or with all descendants if no argument is passed.

function.name: elements
function.description: Takes one optional argument, the name of elements you are looking for, and returns an XMLList with all matching child elements.
function.summary: Takes one optional argument, the name of elements you are looking for, and returns an XMLList with all matching child elements.

function.name: elements
function.description: Takes one optional argument, the name of elements you are looking for, and returns an XMLList with all matching child elements.
function.summary: Takes one optional argument, the name of elements you are looking for, and returns an XMLList with all matching child elements.

function.name: hasComplexContent
function.description: Returns false for XML objects of node kind 'text', 'attribute', 'comment', and 'processing-instruction'. For objects of kind 'element' it checks whether the element has at least one child element.
function.summary: Returns false for XML objects of node kind 'text', 'attribute', 'comment', and 'processing-instruction'.

function.name: hasOwnProperty
function.description: Returns true if the XML object the method is called on has a property of that name.
function.summary: Returns true if the XML object the method is called on has a property of that name.

function.name: hasSimpleContent
function.description: Returns true for XML objects of node kind text or attribute. For XML objects of node kind element it returns true if the element has no child elements and false otherwise. For other node kinds (comment, processing instruction) the method always returns false.
function.summary: Returns true for XML objects of node kind text or attribute.

function.name: inScopeNamespaces
function.description: Returns an array of Namespace objects representing the namespace that are in scope for this XML object.
function.summary: Returns an array of Namespace objects representing the namespace that are in scope for this XML object.

function.name: insertChildAfter
function.description: Takes two arguments, an existing child to insert after and the new child to be inserted. If the first argument is null then the second argument is inserted as the first child of this XML.
function.summary: Takes two arguments, an existing child to insert after and the new child to be inserted.

function.name: insertChildBefore
function.description: Takes two arguments, an existing child to insert before and the new child to be inserted. If the first argument is null then the child is inserted as the last child.
function.summary: Takes two arguments, an existing child to insert before and the new child to be inserted.

function.name: length
function.description: This always returns 1. This is done to blur the distinction between an XML object and an XMLList containing exactly one value.
function.summary: This always returns 1.

function.name: localName
function.description: returns the local name part if the XML object has a name.
function.summary: returns the local name part if the XML object has a name.

function.name: name
function.description: Returns the qualified name (a QName object) of the XML object it is called
function.summary: Returns the qualified name (a QName object) of the XML object it is called

function.name: namespace
function.description: If no argument is passed to the method then it returns the namespace associated with the qualified name of this XML object. If a prefix is passed to the method then it looks for a matching namespace in the in scope namespace of this XML object and returns it when found, otherwise undefined is returned.
function.summary: If no argument is passed to the method then it returns the namespace associated with the qualified name of this XML object.

function.name: namespace
function.description: If no argument is passed to the method then it returns the namespace associated with the qualified name of this XML object. If a prefix is passed to the method then it looks for a matching namespace in the in scope namespace of this XML object and returns it when found, otherwise undefined is returned.
function.summary: If no argument is passed to the method then it returns the namespace associated with the qualified name of this XML object.

function.name: namespaceDeclarations
function.description: Returns an array with the namespace declarations associated with the XML object it is called on.
function.summary: Returns an array with the namespace declarations associated with the XML object it is called on.

function.name: nodeKind
function.description: Returns a string denoting the kind of node this XML object represents. Possible values: 'element', 'attribute', 'text', 'comment', 'processing-instruction'.
function.summary: Returns a string denoting the kind of node this XML object represents.

function.name: normalize
function.description: Returns this XML object after normalizing all text content.
function.summary: Returns this XML object after normalizing all text content.

function.name: parent
function.description: Returns the parent XML object of this XML object or null if there is no parent.
function.summary: Returns the parent XML object of this XML object or null if there is no parent.

function.name: prependChild
function.description: Iinserts the given value as the first child of the XML object and returns the XML object.
function.summary: Iinserts the given value as the first child of the XML object and returns the XML object.

function.name: processingInstructions
function.description: If no argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all the children of the XML object which are processing instructions. If an argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all children of the XML object which are processing instructions where the name matches the argument.
function.summary: If no argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all the children of the XML object which are processing instructions.

function.name: processingInstructions
function.description: If no argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all the children of the XML object which are processing instructions. If an argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all children of the XML object which are processing instructions where the name matches the argument.
function.summary: If no argument is passed in then the method returns an XMLList with all the children of the XML object which are processing instructions.

function.name: propertyIsEnumerable
function.description: Returns true if the property name is '0' and false otherwise.
function.summary: Returns true if the property name is '0' and false otherwise.

function.name: removeNamespace
function.description: Removes the namespace from the in scope namespaces of this XML object if the namespace is not used for the qualified name of the object or its attributes.
function.summary: Removes the namespace from the in scope namespaces of this XML object if the namespace is not used for the qualified name of the object or its attributes.

function.name: replace
function.description: Takes two arguments, the property name of the property / properties to be replaced, and the value to replace the properties.
function.summary: Takes two arguments, the property name of the property / properties to be replaced, and the value to replace the properties.

function.name: setChildren
function.description: Replaces all children of the XML object with this value. The method returns the XML object it is called on.
function.summary: Replaces all children of the XML object with this value.

function.name: setLocalName
function.description: Changes the local name of this XML object to the name passed in.
function.summary: Changes the local name of this XML object to the name passed in.

function.name: setName
function.description: Replaces the name of this XML object with the name passed in.
function.summary: Replaces the name of this XML object with the name passed in.

function.name: setNamespace
function.description: Changes the namespace associated with the name of this XML object to the new namespace.
function.summary: Changes the namespace associated with the name of this XML object to the new namespace.

function.name: setSettings
function.description: Allows the global XML settings to be adjusted or restored to their default values.
function.summary: Allows the global XML settings to be adjusted or restored to their default values.

function.name: setSettings
function.description: Allows the global XML settings to be adjusted or restored to their default values.
function.summary: Allows the global XML settings to be adjusted or restored to their default values.

parameter.name: settings
parameter.description: The new settings that should be applied globally to the XML object.

function.name: settings
function.description: Returns an object containing the global XML settings.
function.summary: Returns an object containing the global XML settings.

function.name: text
function.description: Returns an XMLList with all the children of this XML object that represent text nodes.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with all the children of this XML object that represent text nodes.

function.name: toString
function.description: Returns a convenient string value of this XML object.
function.summary: Returns a convenient string value of this XML object.

function.name: toXMLString
function.description: Returns a string with the serialized XML markup for this XML object. XML.prettyPrinting and XML.prettyIndent settings affect the returned string.
function.summary: Returns a string with the serialized XML markup for this XML object.

function.name: valueOf
function.description: The method simply returns the XML object it is called on.
function.summary: The method simply returns the XML object it is called on.

function.name: attribute
function.description: It calls the method attribute of each object in this XMLList and returns the results in order in an XMLList.
function.summary: It calls the method attribute of each object in this XMLList and returns the results in order in an XMLList.

function.name: attributes
function.description: Calls the method attributes of each object in this XMLList and returns an XMLList with the results in order.
function.summary: Calls the method attributes of each object in this XMLList and returns an XMLList with the results in order.

function.name: child
function.description: Calls the method child of each XML object in this XMLList object to return an XMLList with the matching children in order.
function.summary: Calls the method child of each XML object in this XMLList object to return an XMLList with the matching children in order.

function.name: children
function.description: Returns an XMLList with the children of all XML objects in this XMLList.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with the children of all XML objects in this XMLList.

function.name: comments
function.description: Returns an XMLList with all the comment child nodes of XML objects in this XMLList in order.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with all the comment child nodes of XML objects in this XMLList in order.

function.name: contains
function.description: Returns true if there is (at least) one XML object in the list that compares equal to the value
function.summary: Returns true if there is (at least) one XML object in the list that compares equal to the value

function.name: copy
function.description: Returns a deep copy of the XMLList it is called on.
function.summary: Returns a deep copy of the XMLList it is called on.

function.name: descendants
function.description: Returns an XMLList with all of the matching descendants of all XML objects.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with all of the matching descendants of all XML objects.

function.name: descendants
function.description: Returns an XMLList with all of the matching descendants of all XML objects.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with all of the matching descendants of all XML objects.

function.name: elements
function.description: Returns an XMLList with the matching element children of all XML objects in this XMLList.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with the matching element children of all XML objects in this XMLList.

function.name: hasComplexContent
function.description: Returns true if the XMLList contains exactly one XML object which has complex content or if the XMLList contains several XML objects.
function.summary: Returns true if the XMLList contains exactly one XML object which has complex content or if the XMLList contains several XML objects.

function.name: hasOwnProperty
function.description: Returns true if the XMLList object has a property of that name and false otherwise.
function.summary: Returns true if the XMLList object has a property of that name and false otherwise.

function.name: hasSimpleContent
function.description: Returns true if the XMLList is empty or contains exactly one XML object which has simple content or contains no elements at all.
function.summary: Returns true if the XMLList is empty or contains exactly one XML object which has simple content or contains no elements at all.

function.name: length
function.description: Returns the number of XML objects this XMLList contains.
function.summary: Returns the number of XML objects this XMLList contains.

function.name: normalize
function.description: Returns the XMLList object it is called on after joining adjacent text nodes and removing empty text nodes.
function.summary: Returns the XMLList object it is called on after joining adjacent text nodes and removing empty text nodes.

function.name: parent
function.description: Returns the common parent of all XML objects in this XMLList if all those objects have the same parent.
function.summary: Returns the common parent of all XML objects in this XMLList if all those objects have the same parent.

function.name: processingInstructions
function.description: Returns an XMLList with all the matching processing instruction child nodes of all XML objects in this XMLList.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with all the matching processing instruction child nodes of all XML objects in this XMLList.

function.name: processingInstructions
function.description: Returns an XMLList with all the matching processing instruction child nodes of all XML objects in this XMLList.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList with all the matching processing instruction child nodes of all XML objects in this XMLList.

function.name: propertyIsEnumerable
function.description: Returns true if the property name converted to a number is greater than or equal to 0 and less than the length of this XMLList.
function.summary: Returns true if the property name converted to a number is greater than or equal to 0 and less than the length of this XMLList.

function.name: text
function.description: Returns an XMLList containing all the text child nodes of all the XML objects contained in this XMLList.
function.summary: Returns an XMLList containing all the text child nodes of all the XML objects contained in this XMLList.

function.name: toString
function.description: Returns a string representation of the XMLList
function.summary: Returns a string representation of the XMLList

function.name: toXMLString
function.description: Returns the concatenation of toXMLString called on each XML object. The result for each XML object is put on a separate line if XML.prettyPrinting is true.
function.summary: Returns the concatenation of toXMLString called on each XML object.

function.name: valueOf
function.description: Simply returns the XMLList object it is called on.
function.summary: Simply returns the XMLList object it is called on.
